alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Essex; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 7:35PM EDT until April 01 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Northumberland County in eastern Virginia... Northwestern Richmond County in east central Virginia... East central Caroline County in north central Virginia... Westmoreland County in east central Virginia... Northwestern Essex County in east central Virginia... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 733 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Loretto, or 7 miles northwest of Champlain, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Leedstown around 740 PM EDT. Montross and Newland around 750 PM EDT. Hague around 800 PM EDT. Coles Point and Kinsale around 805 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Lerty, Ethel, Currioman Landing, Threeway, Hustle, Oak Grove, Supply, Singerly, Mount Holly and Peeds. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
